ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Digest Number 839
ygData.msgSnippet: Hehe, you re right about that. It s one thing that annoys me about being a bard, other than dieing all the time but these 2 factors are linked. Don t know if
ygData.messageBody:
Hehe, you're right about that. It's one thing that annoys me about being a
bard, other than dieing all the time but these 2 factors are linked.
Don't know if you have these books in America (I am from England), but when
I was younger I used to love reading the Asterix books, and the bard in
those stories was portrayed as a dreadful singer and a clumsy fool. Gives
me a chuckle as I think Verant based the bard class around that character.

Madagan Songweaver, Bard of 42 Songs <Guardians of Light>
Veeshan Server

Ps, I noticed whilst in my local bard guild that the new skills (parry and
riposte) were there to be trained in. I do however wish bards got an extra
attack skill for after level 50. We are so poor at fighting, Verant could
at least give us double attack after 50 levels of suffering without it.
It's not like we are gonna be able to solo stuff at that level so why would
it hurt? It would simply make us deal a little extra damage therefore
making us more appealing to groups (only problem would be the extra taunt
from the addittional dmg).




Bill Costlow <atlatyl@...> on 27/03/2000 13:49:39

Please respond to eqbards@onelist.com

To: eqbards@onelist.com
cc: (bcc: John Senior/M&G)
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Digest Number 839




From: Bill Costlow <atlatyl@...>

--- Renee Cole <nat_ive@...> wrote:

>It was so bad I got to the point I never
> played any songs in GF or
> I'd draw a huge crowd of booing mobs all armed with
> rotting vegetables.

LOL! I've found that halfway thru many fights I get
two-three mobs on me and the warriors can't taunt them
off.

We sing really well...but what are we REALLY good at?
We are the taunters from hell.
